intro: Eriocaulon thunbergii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as swamps and pond margins. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
